meanings.definition: The edge of a woven fabric finished so as to prevent raveling.
meanings.sent1: The selvedge of the cloth was neatly stitched to keep it from fraying.
meanings.sent2: She admired the selvedge of the scarf, appreciating its clean finish.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the selvedge of the tablecloth, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The selvedge of the tapestry held the story of the weaver's skill and care.
meanings.sent5: The selvedge, like a guardian, protected the fabric from coming undone.

meanings.definition: A finished edge of a fabric that prevents it from unraveling.
meanings.sent1: The tailor carefully trimmed the selvedge of the dress to ensure its durability.
meanings.sent2: The selvedge of the blanket was reinforced to withstand frequent use.
meanings.sent3: The child pretended the selvedge of the curtain was a magical barrier.
meanings.sent4: The selvedge of the rug held the memories of many footsteps over time.
meanings.sent5: The selvedge, like a loyal companion, kept the fabric intact through years of wear.
